item.title: Report E-2023050631
item.description:
Report E-2023050631

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-16T15:09:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: W WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Customer requires a sample from the discharge pipe of trailer before offloading. Driver removed 2 inch cap on discharge pipe and opened the internal valve to flood pipe between the external valve. Driver did not realize the external valve was open prior to departing our facility, so when he attempted to fill the tube he immediately put product on the ground due to head pressure and open internal and external valves. He shut the internal valve immediately and driver contacted his supervisor for assistance. An external emergency response contractor was hired to clean up the customer's site. Response cost is an estimate at this time.

item.title: Report X-2023050905
item.description:
Report X-2023050905

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-16T15:09:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A SPLILL AT DOOR IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER SAW A PACKAGE WITH A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL ON THE FLOOR WITH A PUDDLE UNDERNEATH IT. RESPONDER REFERRED TO THE DECISION TREE AND WEARING PROPER PPE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2023050054
item.description:
Report I-2023050054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-15T21:09:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-09
  • City: Walterboro
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BCP TRANSPORTATION, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our driver was driving in heavy stop and go traffic due to coming up on an accident. The driver in front of ours, also a tractor trailer, came to a sudden stop and our driver did not have time to stop before rear ending the trailer in front of them. Both drivers pulled off to the side to assess damage and swap information when our driver noticed some liquid seeping from out of the side of the trailer. The driver called the safety manager who contacted a spill clean up crew to the scene. In the meantime, the fire department and police department handled the scene and containing the minor spill. Once the crew arrived, it was determined that a group of 55 gallon drums were pushed to the nose of the trailer due to the harsh stop when rear ending the trailer in front of our driver. Multiple barrels were disformed, one was cracked near the top of the barrel and seeping the formaldehyde liquid onto the floor of the trailer and seeping through the crack of the trailer floor and wall onto the pavement for roughly three hours. By the time the barrel was sealed back up, 10 gallons were lost from the barrel, however less made its way through the crack of the trailer floor and onto pavement. Once the scene, cargo, and trailer were contained, our driver was able to proceed to the.next truck stop which was 4 miles away from the scene. We then took the trailer to the clean up crew's warehouse and they unloaded the trailer, decontaminated it, and reloaded the trailer.

item.title: Report I-2023050038
item.description:
Report I-2023050038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-15T21:09:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-28
  • City: Portland
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OAK HARBOR FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As dockworker was loading the second of two totes into trailer T53165, the tote began to massively leak. The forklift could not get grip to back out of the trailer so it was towed out with another forklift. The long forks were used to pull the Ieaking tote out of the trailer. By this time most of the contents had already emptied from the trailer. The spill which began Ieaking from the trailer onto the apron/yard was walled off with absorbant to prevent spreading and continuously added as it spread. After the tote was pulled from the trailer, we could find no physical damage to it. The valve was found on the trailer floor beside where the tote was. It appears no locking seal was used on the valve. For cleanup, ACT Environmental was called. They are currently working on transferring into recovery drums.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 3 of the metal 5 gallon enviroboxexes of floor stripper (un3267) had been crushed and had released 15 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023030774
item.description:
Report E-2023030774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-15T21:09:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-29
  • City: JOHNSTON
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While performing dock check a supervisor discovered a drum that was wet on top. Further investigation revealed that the drum had these drain holes on the top chime and we area assuming that they must have compromised the integrity of the drum when they were formed and as a result led to the unintentional release. The material on top of the drum was cleaned with absorbent pads and the drain holes were sealed with putty and the drum is currently being held awaiting disposition.

item.description:
Report E-2023020481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-15T21:09:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-02
  • City: CRANSTON
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon identification of the van trailer on fire the company employee notified his manager who called 911 for the fire department. The company contacted the NRC, the Rhode Island DEM, company Health & Safety and Compliance managers. The company closed off all storm drains to prevent any release to a waterway. The fire department extinguished the fire with non-toxic foam. The company collected all foam, water, fire debris, remaining waste and placed into suitable containers for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022090257
item.description:
Report X-2022090257

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-15T21:09:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-09
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO BAY FOR A LEAKER. FOUND THE BOX ON THE GRATING AND LEAKING DOWN THE CEMENT WALL CAUSING A PUDDLE ON THE FLOOR. ODOR WAS EXTREMELY NOXIOUS. USED THE DECISION TREE AND NOTIFIED THE SHIFT RMP. USED AN INDUTRIAL FAN TO HELP WITH THE FUMES TO BE ABLE TO CLEAN SMALL PUDDLE AND MOVED THE LEAKER OUTDOORS. THEN CORDENED OFF THE LEAKER WITH TAPE AND CONES. THE RMP FOLLOWED THE CHAIN OF COMMAND AND NOTIFIED BASE. BASE THEN CALLED AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2022080224
item.description:
Report X-2022080224

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-15T21:09:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-02
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALLED TO THE UNLOAD TO CLEAN UP A HAZMAT SPILL AT DOOR 2. THE PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. IT HAD SHIPPING PAPERS AND A UNSPEC. IT WAS WET AND HAD A BIG PUDDLE UNDERNEATH. CLEANED UP THE AREA AND BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
